page.title: 03LOCAL NEWSPAPER
page.content: WE INTERVIEWED THE DEPUTY EDITOR OF THE LOCAL NEWSPAPER,THE RETFORD TIMES.WE BEGAN THE INTERVIEW BY ASKING ABOUT THE ORIGINS OF THE NEWSPAPER.THE DEPUTY EDITOR EXPLAINED THAT THE PAPER HAD BEEN FOUNDED IN 1869 BY A GROUP OF LOCAL BUSINESS MEN LED BY A MAN CALLED HOLLINGSWORTH.HE WENT ON TO SAY THAT ORIGINALLY THE NEWSPAPER HAD BEEN KNOWN AS "THE RETFORD AND WORKSOP HERALD,AND THE NEWARK AND MANSFIELD TIMES".WE ASKED WHY THE NEWSPAPER HAD CHANGED ITS NAME AND HE TOLD US THAT THE ORIGINAL NAME HAD BEEN USED TO ATTRACT ADVERTISING BY PRETENDING THAT THE NEWSPAPER HAD A WIDER CIRCULATION THAN IT ACTUALLY DID.WE ASKED ABOUT THE PRESENT CIRCULATION OF THE TIMES.THIS WAS ABOUT 10,000 COPIES PER WEEK ALTHOUGH AT ONE POINT THIS FIGURE REACHED 12,000.THE NEWSPAPER IS NOW OWNED BY THE LARGE NORTHCLIFFE GROUP
